intro: Senecio cisplatinus, commonly known as the Cisplatin Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
